comments.body: It's worth mentioning that 8001 is hard coded in the example's local webserver ([index.html](https://github.com/roberthbailey/kubernetes/blob/update-sh/examples/update-demo/local/index.html#L25))

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +30,34 @@
You can use bash job control to run this in the background (note that you must use the default port -- 8001 -- for the following demonstration to work properly).  This can sometimes spew to the output so you could also run it in a different terminal.

```
$ ./cluster/kubectl.sh proxy --www=examples/update-demo/local/ &

comments.body: Is there a benefit to serving the static files? Why not have folks visit the file:///... location directly in their browser?
Yeah, you can't do cross-site JavaScript from file:/// urls to the proxy API server.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +46,50 @@
    $ cd kubernetes
    $ cluster/cloudcfg.sh -proxy -www examples/update-demo/local/

Now visit the the [demo website](http://localhost:8001/static/index.html).  You should see two light blue squares with pod IDs and ip addresses.
